title: Business Live: Sterling sags - BBC News
summary: monarch boss apologises to customers and staff .
uber chief in london for tfl talks .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all for the business live page for tonight .
please join us again tomorrow from 06:00 .

documents.title: wall street hits new record
text: us stock indexes touched new record highs , boosted by a rally in tech stocks and gains in ford motor and general motors after strong september vehicle sales .
major carmakers reported higher us new vehicle sales in september , as consumers in hurricane-hit parts of the country rushed to replace flood-damaged cars .
general motors ' shares rose 3.1 % to $ 43.45 , while ford 's stock was up 2.1 % at $ 12.34 .
technology stocks have rebounded from a sharp selling seen last week , with apple and intel supporting gains on tuesday .
the dow jones industrial average was up 84 points or 0.37 % at 22,641.67 .
the s & p 500 at 2,534.58 , up 5 points or 0.22 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq was at 6,531.71 , a rise of 15 points or 0.23 % .

documents.title: monarch closure timing 'could have been much worse '
text: peter jenkins , managing director of holiday accommodation provider sun-hat villas and resorts , has told the bbc that the timing of monarch 's closure could have been much worse for its customers .
`` normally airlines go out of business in may at a time when there is all the summer capacity to look at , '' he said .
`` the timing of this was quite fortuitous , as it was probably at a time when it had least impact on customers .
`` for example , we have lots of people booked to stay with us next year who have n't booked their flights yet or who have booked with other companies or airlines . ''

there has been minimal disruption for mr jenkins ' current clients and he added : `` we have just been trying to be as flexible as possible with moving dates or extending their stays until they can get new flights . ''

documents.title: help to buy : who has been helped ?
text: reality check has been crunching the numbers on the government 's help to buy scheme following the prime minister 's annoucement on sunday of a further £ 10bn to widen the number of first-time buyers eligible for assistance .
read more here .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: apple and samsung : rivals and partners
text: apple 's iphone x goes on sale next month , what 's interesting is that apple 's rival samsung will make $ 110 from each phone sold , according to the wall street journal .

samsung supplies screens and memory for the iphone , which according to the article means that samsung is likely to make more money from components in the iphone x , than parts from its own galaxy s8 .

documents.title: sterling slips to three week low
text: sterling slipped to a three-week low on tuesday after data showed construction sector activity tumbled in september , and as investors worried about political and economic uncertainty surrounding britain 's exit from the european union .

brexit minister david davis told the conservative party conference on tuesday that britain wants to negotiate an exit agreement with the eu but is ready to walk away with no deal , and that officials were `` contingency planning '' to make sure all scenarios were covered .

the comments added to a sense of uncertainty over britain 's future - both political and economic - for investors that has dragged sterling down more than 10 percent against the dollar since last june 's vote for brexit .

despite foreign minister boris johnson saying at the conference that the cabinet was united behind every syllable of prime minister theresa may 's recent speech in florence , the event has been overshadowed by reports of disunity and leadership bids from rivals in the government .

documents.title: eu 'to tell amazon to pay luxembourg back taxes '
text: eu regulators are expected to order amazon on wednesday to pay luxembourg millions of euros in back taxes , reuters reports .
the eu competition enforcer estimated a tax bill of about 400m euros a year ago , reuters says .

the european commission ruling wraps up a three-year long investigation into whether amazon received an unfair advantage based on a 2003 luxembourg tax ruling which allows an amazon subsidiary to pay less tax there than other companies .

documents.title: royal mail : ballot does n't necessarily mean strike
text: the royal mail has put out a press release to the stock market saying it is `` very disappointed '' that cwu union members have voted in favour of industrial action in a dispute over pay and pensions .
however , royal mail says : `` a ballot result for industrial action does not necessarily mean there will be industrial action .
`` royal mail is committed to further talks as a matter of urgency , to reach agreement with the cwu .
`` there are no grounds for industrial action .
we want to reach agreement . ''

documents.title: royal mail strike action 'a last resort '
text: steph tells me on @ twitterid that strike action was a last resort , but needed to protect the 500 yr old public service she loves # royalmail

documents.title: boris johnson : let the british lion roar
text: boris johnson has said it is time to `` let the british lion roar '' as he called for brexit to be a moment of national renewal .
the foreign secretary told tory activists the uk `` can win the future '' and should stop treating the referendum result as if it were `` plague of boils '' .
in his speech , he praised theresa may 's `` steadfast '' leadership over europe .
and he insisted the whole cabinet was united behind her aim of getting a `` great brexit deal '' .
read more here .

documents.title: wells fargo shares fall after senator comments
text: senator warren said mr sloan should be fired for failed leadership and that `` wells fargo is not going to change with you in charge '' .
senators criticised wells fargo , saying the us bank had not done enough to reform the corporate culture that led to the creation of millions of fake accounts .
read more here .
update : wells fargo shares fall 1.1 percent after senator elizabeth warren makes remarks on ceo tim sloan in senate testimony
good just another 98.9 % and that should work
the devil

documents.title: brazil 's 'biggest bank robbery ' tunnel
text: police in brazil have arrested 16 people accused of digging a tunnel in sao paulo that lead to a bank branch .
robbers were plotting to stage what police called the biggest bank robbery in the world '' .
criminals in brazil were digging for more than three months a 600-metre long tunnel to reach a bank branch of banco do brasil .
police said bank robbers invested $ 1.2m in their enterprise and were hoping to walk away with $ 320m .
on monday they were all arrested in a raid - just as they were about to begin drilling into the bank 's coffers .
in 2005 , a criminal gang managed to dig a tunnel in the city of fortaleza , stealing $ 50m .
most robbers in that gang were eventually arrested .
author: Daniel Gallas
BBC South America business correspondent

documents.title: london underground strike called off
text: a strike by london underground drivers on thursday has been called off after progress was made during talks , drivers ' union aslef says .
thursday 's strike by london underground drivers called off after progress in talks , union aslef says

documents.title: uber meeting 'constructive ' says tfl
text: both transport for london and uber have said a meeting between them today was `` constructive '' .

a tfl spokesperson said : `` today 's constructive meeting centred on what needs to happen to ensure a thriving taxi and private hire market in london where everyone operates to the same high standards .
further steps in this process will take place over the coming weeks . ''
an uber spokesperson said : `` our new chief executive [ dara khosrowshahi ] had a constructive meeting with the transport commissioner [ mike brown ] this afternoon .
`` we hope to have further discussions over the coming weeks as we are determined to make things right in london . ''
uber lost its licence to operate in london in september .

documents.title: monarch 'keeps on hr team to deal with redundancies '
text: on monday a total of 1,858 monarch employees were made redundant .
of these , 1,760 were employees of monarch airlines , while 98 were employed by monarch travel group .
here 's an update on the situation for monarch airlines staff from one of the kpmg joint administrators blair nimmo :
importantly , we have retained the company 's 17-strong hr team to provide assistance to the rest of the workforce , including help in making claims to the redundancy payments office .
`` their support , at what is also a very difficult time for them , has been crucial and we are very grateful to them .
`` within the next 48 hours , all employees will be receiving a substantial pack of correspondence from the joint administrators to assist them with making their claims . ''

documents.title: monarch customers claiming refunds 'should keep trying '
text: some bank staff may prevaricate because chargeback is n't well understood , but monarch 's former banks should cough up for a valid claim
bankers tell me monarch 's banks `` ca n't refuse to accept a chargeback '' even if they do n't have funds from the airline to cover it
nice of those particular bankers to help get the word out .
looking out for the consumer are they ?
monarch collapse/claiming refunds - anyone having trouble claiming a chargeback after paying by debit card should keep on trying 1/2

documents.title: breakingroyal mail employees vote in favour of strike action
text: the royal mail is facing the threat of the first national strike since it was privatised after workers voted massively in favour of industrial action in a dispute over pensions , pay and jobs .
members of the communication workers union ( cwu ) backed walkouts by 89 % on a turnout of 73 % of the 110,000 balloted .
it passed the threshold set in the government 's controversial trade union act , under which ballots need a 50 % turnout for industrial action to go ahead .

documents.title: davies speech 'a damp squib ' says starmer
text: labour 's shadow brexit secretary keir starmer says his conservative counterpart david davies gave a `` damp squib '' of a speech at the conservative party conference :
the speech `` offered nothing new on how the government intends to break the impasse in brexit negotiations and deliver a new progressive partnership with the eu , '' mr starmer says .
`` on the day the european parliament voted to delay future trade talks with britain , it is now clear that tory infighting is harming the brexit process .
`` paralysis in the negotiations risks havoc for the british economy and uncertainty for eu and uk citizens . ''

documents.title: boris johnson lauds may
text: prime minister theresa may will make a success of brexit and the cabinet is united behind every syllable of her recent speech in florence , foreign secretary boris johnson has claimed .

mr johnson , one of the leaders of the leave campaign in last year 's eu referendum , had provoked the ire of cabinet colleagues by repeatedly attempting to portray himself as the champion of a genuinely `` bold brexit '' .
`` based on that florence speech on whose every syllable , i can tell you , the whole cabinet is united , '' mr johnson said .
`` the whole country owes her a debt for her steadfastness in taking britain forward as she will to a great brexit deal . ''

documents.title: boris makes the case for free trade
text: speaking at the conservative party conference , foreign secretary boris johnson says :

`` there is a huge desire out there for us to engage with the world more emphatically than ever before , and after brexit that 's what our friends and partners are going to get , as this country is freed from endlessly trying to block things in brussels committee rooms , freed to stop being negative and start being positive about what we believe in , including free trade . ''

`` yes we are leaving the eu , and as the prime minister has said in her florence speech , we can create a deep and special partnership built on free trade , with a strong eu buttressed and supported by a strong uk . ''

documents.title: scotland fracking ban 'a huge win for campaigners '
text: environmental campaign group greenpeace has welcomed the scottish government ban on fracking .
elisabeth whitebread , energy campaigner at greenpeace uk , said it is `` a huge win for thousands of people who have campaigned against fracking for six years . ''
`` unlike westminster , holyrood is listening to public opinion , '' she said .
`` we already have more gas than we can afford to burn , and as well as damaging the climate , fracking will cause local noise , air and light pollution . ''
`` the conservative government in westminster is now alone in backing fracking and looks very isolated indeed .
across england , growing numbers of local people will continue to oppose fracking and the failure of democracy on this issue . ''
friends of the earth scotland head of campaigns mary church said : `` this is a victory for the environment and for local communities fighting fracking .

text: monarch boss andrew swaffield set up a new consultancy firm yesterday .

documents.title: defence secretary 'trolling leave campaign '

that 's what politicians do is n't it , pluck things out of the air .
you know , abolish tuition fees '' just before an election .
i 'm delighted we are , the navy has been allowed to run down and there are growing threats worldwide .

documents.title: tesco employees quit over profit overstatement
text: two tesco employees felt so compromised by the `` biggest kept secret '' in the supermarket - its inflating of profits in 2014 - that they quit their jobs , a court has heard .
richard parsons , a project manager at the supermarket , in an exit interview said : `` it has broken me '' and that he was angry at having been put in a position which compromised his ethics .
sasha wass qc , prosecuting , told jurors : `` richard articulated that this is the biggest kept secret in tesco and if this was to get out , it would not be good for tesco . ''
jurors also heard that former tesco accountant aysen nadiri quit her role on august 26 2014 .

`` miss nadiri became increasingly concerned about the message from senior management because they refused to accept that targets could not be met and they had a disregard , in miss nadiri 's view , for proper accounting principles .

carl rogberg , 50 , chris bush , 51 , and john scouler , 49 , are alleged to have failed to correct inaccurately recorded income figures which were published to auditors , other employees and the wider market .

documents.title: scottish government announces ban on fracking
text: the scottish government has announced a ban on fracking .
energy minister paul wheelhouse confirmed the government will outlaw the controversial gas extraction technique in scotland .
a moratorium on the practice has been in place since january 2015 and the government 's decision follows extensive consultation and consideration of reports on its potential impact .
mr wheelhouse said : `` fracking can not , and will not take place in scotland . ''

documents.title: the 5g revolution is nigh
text: technology of business editor matthew wall tweets :
from platooning lorries to remote surgery , mobile vr to smart cities the technologies to be enabled by 5g .
we live in exciting times , @ twitterid do you think we can expect to see a substantial drop in broadband costs in the next few years ?
not necessarily .
infrastructure costs may well be passed on to consumers and 5g marketed as a premium service .
ah , that may be the case !

documents.title: 'a new mood '
text: brexit secretary david davies is giving a speech at the conservative party conference .
he says :
`` a year later , there 's a new mood .
they 're fed up that people in westminster seem stuck in an endless debate while the rest of the world wants to get a move on .
over a year later , i still get people coming up to me every single day saying 'best of luck ' , 'get a good deal for us mr davies , and even , 'surely it ca n't be that difficult ' .
and that 's just the cabinet . ''
`` we have been given a one-off , time limited , extraordinary opportunity .
an opportunity to make sure that all our decisions about the future of this country are taken by our parliaments , our courts , our institutions . ''

documents.title: caa had to wait to act over monarch
text: civil aviation authority chair dame deirdre hutton has explained why the organisation could not act before monarch 's closure announcement , even though it was known the firm was in difficulty .
`` the regulator really ca n't step in until a company goes into administration , that is completely a matter for the company directors , '' she told the bbc .
`` it would be neither possible nor legal for us to give out confidential financial information while a company is still operating legally .

`` monarch did n't own the planes , the planes were leased - so as soon as the company went into administration , the owners of the planes took them back and that 's why we 've had to acquire planes from 16 different countries [ to bring people back ] . ''

documents.title: i had that uber boss in the back of my cab once
text: technology correspondent rory cellan-jones is waiting for some news from the uber/tfl meeting , and let 's face it , he 's not very happy l
disgruntled hacks increasingly convinced that the uber/tfl meeting is happening in the back of an uber somewhere
they 're just round the corner , wo n't be five minutes
luckily they 're not uber hacks or they would n't be paid while hanging around for their next question .
# gigeconomy
may be the driver has got lost ?
looks like @ twitterid may have benefited from fueling said disgruntled hacks !

documents.title: fidelity cuts fees
text: fidelity international will cut fees for investors in its active equity funds if they underperform or simply tracks its benchmark .

the asset manager 's move comes as fund managers that actively shares and bonds face pressure on fees from cost-conscious investors and regulators who question the value of investing in these funds compared with lower-cost index-tracking funds .
the financial conduct authority said in a market study earlier this year that the asset management industry 's profits were persistently high and suggested the average client may be short-changed .
`` we have listened to the criticism of the asset management industry and rethought our approach to charging clients , '' fidelity international president brian conroy said .
`` in the future we believe the vast majority of funds will charge on a variable basis as well . ''

documents.title: helping hand for former prisoners
text: former offenders will be helped into jobs under a new scheme matching employers with prisoners , the justice secretary has announced .

david lidington said a new national task force would ensure training in prisons `` match the demands '' in the local job market , as he outlined his ambition to persuade employers of the benefits of hiring former offenders .

he told the conservative party conference in manchester : `` the evidence shows that a former prisoner who has got work - who has got both responsibility and the opportunities that a job provides is far less likely to reoffend in the future .
getting prisoners into employment works . ''

documents.title: a divine answer to climate change ?
text: more than 40 catholic institutions have announced the biggest faith-based divestment from fossil fuels .
geoff davies - the `` green bishop '' of cape town , tells bbc marketplace his diocese will be investing about $ 300,000 in renewables .
we can make lots of money out of fossil fuels , we know , but we 've got to stop doing so .
and so we want to invest our money in renewable energy , '' he says .
`` trump said he wants to pull out [ of the paris accord ] because it 's bad for american business .
but i think the hurricanes and the wildfires have been far more costly . ''
listen to a clip here :
on today 's @ twitterid on @ twitterid i spoke to @ twitterid on why catholics are divesting from fossil fuels - it 's 'god 's answer ' .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: former unison chief dies
text: rodney bickerstaffe , former general secretary of unison has died aged 72 , the union said .
he led the public sector union nupe before it merged to become unison .

unison chief dave prentis said : `` rodney , or bick as he was known to many , was a great personal friend to many of us and a dedicated champion of all the union members he proudly represented throughout his career .
he coupled a great sense of humour and love of laughter with a deep-rooted sense of social justice and commitment to unison .
our thoughts are with rodney 's family . ''

documents.title: unilever reviews its colman 's plantthis is a statement from unilever :
text: following britvic 's announcement that it is proposing to close its manufacturing site in norwich , unilever will be launching a review of its production which is co-located at the site .
britvic and unilever 's operations have been uniquely intertwined at the site for many years , relying on a shared infrastructure .
although no decisions have been made , we need to recognise that britvic 's proposed withdrawal would have serious implications for unilever in norwich .
the review will look in detail at the impact of britvic 's proposed withdrawal from the site and will consider options for the most effective sourcing of the current norwich product range .
one of those options will include the potential closure of our norwich factory .
`` colman 's has been an important part of norwich and the surrounding area for more than 200 years and , whatever the outcome of the review , we will work hard to retain this link .
we remain firmly committed to uk manufacturing .
we recognise this review will cause concern for our norwich employees , suppliers and the local community .
we 're committed to treating our employees and suppliers fairly , and providing support during this difficult time . ''

documents.title: ireland may face apple action
text: you might remember that last year the european union ordered ireland to recover up to €13bn from apple in back taxes .
well , according to bloomberg , ireland has failed to recover that money and , as a result , could be in trouble with european authorities .
the article says that the european commission might issue a so-called non-compliance action as soon as this week .
ireland is supposed to be collecting the money and putting it into a special fund , where it will sit until the appeal process is over .

documents.title: breakingmore rail misery ahead
text: workers on south western railway have voted by 4-1 in favour of striking in the dispute over the role of guards on trains , the rmt union said .

documents.title: unite warns about colman 's plant in norwich
text: colman 's mustard has been made just outside norwich since 1858 , but the unite union says the plant is in jeopardy .
it follows an announcement from britvic which said it is closing a drinks-making operation on the same site .
unite said that the announcement had serious implications for the future of colman 's mustard , which is owned by unilever .
`` unilever has today announced a review of the whole site to be concluded by the end of november .
everything is up for review including expanding its operations , selling part of the site and , more worryingly , closure , '' unite said in a statement .

documents.title: unhappy customers required
text: personal finance correspondent simon gompertz tweets :
get in touch with simon at simon.gompertz @ bbc.co.uk
did anyone buy a monarch holiday or flight on sunday , the day before the collapse ?
i think my cousin lynne did yes .
and it 's her birthday today .

according to her fb post she has re-booked with another airline .
if you want to message me i could try and put you in touch with her .
a week before .
£ 200 down the drain .
not happy !

documents.title: new chief of the train set
text: hornby has appointed lyndon davies as chief executive .
he is currently chairman of oxford diecast , a maker of model vehicles .
he replaces steve cooke who stepped down as chief executive last month , after the company warned over its full-year performance .

documents.title: kpmg probe fast-tracked
text: south africa 's audit regulator will fast-track an investigation into auditor kpmg over its work done for the gupta family , who have links with president jacob zuma , the regulator 's chief executive , bernard agulhas , said on tuesday .
`` in the beginning we did not always receive the information that we required .
it was important that the process is n't delayed , '' he said .
zuma and the guptas have denied wrongdoing .
kpmg said it would cooperate with the probe .

documents.title: end of the line for toyota
text: end of an era in australia today as the last locally made toyota rolled off the production line in melbourne .
ford has already stopped making cars down under and holden , the general motors brand in australia , follows suit later this month .
the closure of the altona plant means about 2,600 workers have lost their jobs .

australia has been producing cars for almost a century , but in the past decade the industry has struggled with a strong aussie dollar , which has squeezed exports and added to rising production costs .

documents.title: pregnancy 'minefield '
text: victoria derbyshire has been talking about maternity discrimination in the workplace on today 's show .
'the government needs to adopt the situation in germany , where pregnant women and new mums can not be made redundant ' - @ twitterid
maria 's concern appears to be at odds with an overarching neo-liberal agenda to reduce employment rights :
it takes 2 to tango what about the men ? people told at risk cud abuse such a system.wud be yet more discrimination against the childless .
i may be wrong but does n't labour law currently stop this through employment tribunal .
after all it would be easy to prove a company made redundant when the business wasnt in trouble
if the uk adopted any working practices from germany it should be mandatory workforce board members , who represent the work force
also known as greedy expense fiddler maria miller .
`` can not '' ?
no .
that 's discrimination too .
we need equality , not more discrimination .
selective equality is n't equality
why would i keep employee who does n't work or attend work because personal reasons & not benefit company and team in any way ?
is it fascism ?
crackpot !
'pregnancy does have an impact on small businesses - it 's a minefield , we need to educate and support firms '
perhaps they should be exempt
yeah cause pregnancy is a new thing .
author: Victoria Derbyshire

documents.title: construction 'heading for recession '
text: with the construction pmi unexpectedly falling to 48.1 in september , samuel tombs at pantheon macroeconomics says the sector is entering its own recession , as brexit risk dampens demand for commercial buildings and housing demand cools .

`` steeper declines in construction output likely lie ahead , given that official data show that new orders fell by 7.8 % quarter-on-quarter in the second quarter - the biggest drop for five years , '' he says .

`` markit also reported that business optimism fell to its second-lowest level since april 2013 , suggesting that the government 's shift to a more accommodating stance in brexit talks has done little to convince builders that clients will sanction delayed projects soon . ''

documents.title: sterling struggles
text: the pound has slipped after the slowdown in the construction sector in september , falling as low as $ 1.3250 after having been trading at about $ 1.3278 before the data was released .
that left sterling down 0.2 % on the day .
it also weakened against the single currency to 1.1293 euros .

documents.title: 'grossly irresponsible ' ?
text: @ amazon has been described as `` grossly irresponsible '' for selling this top about anorexia and bulimia .
should it be banned ?
it should be banned as someone who has an eating disorder this upsets me as it gives the wrong message and makes light of a serious illness
so do n't buy it .
exactly , at what point do we stop selling stuff because someone is offended ?
would n't be nothing to sell
this is not about someone being overly sensitive though is it ?
this is a genuine mental health condition that kills people .
so do cars , guns , and beer .
we do n't have guns in england
that must suck .
actually it 's great we do n't have mass shootings here !
@ twitterid have long story of selling products that stigmatise mental health despite complaints .
just found this using keyword schizophrenia
only libtards would try and stifle speech .
i 'm sure amazon will comply .
that 's disgusting too
technically complainng about words on an item of clothing for sale is n't stifling speech , but you do you .
very simple .
just do n't buy it .
obviously .
that was n't my point though .
only pointing out that you could 've used a more accurate term than stifle speech '' .
libtards want them to stop selling shirt merely for its speech '' .
that 's stifling .
that 's censorship .
you
places like amazon often have rules against stuff like this .
a shirt is n't protected under the 1st amendment .
if it was sold under a more niche market , it most likely would n't be treated the same way .
we do n't like something , so let 's ban it !
it 's not about 'like ' , it 's about the fact it will cause harm .
anyone who finds this funny does n't understand the joke .
what harm will the shirt cause ?
hurt feelings aside .
honestly , it can cause a sufferer to feel belittled and their mental illness invalid , therefore they wo n't seek help .
it may sound silly 1/
but when suffering from this kind of stuff this attitude can do this .
maybe not this hoodie exactly , but it 's a symptom of the attitude 2/
which would cause that kind of situation .
it 's not about offence , it 's about the real world approach to serious mental illnesses 3/3
meh if they know they have a problem '' then the shirt does n't matter .
author: Victoria Derbyshire

documents.title: brexit borrowing risks for banks
text: brexit poses risks to the ability of uk companies to borrow from european banks and to some clearing activity , which might have to relocate from london once britain leaves the eu , the bank of england said .
banks from the eu and other associated countries accounted for about 10 % of lending to uk companies , the bank 's financial policy committee said .
those banks can operate as branches but might have to upgrade to fully fledge subsidiaries after brexit - a process that could take many months .

`` the risk of disruption to wholesale uk banking services appeared to be slightly higher than previously thought , given that a number of eea ( european economic area ) firms branching into the uk were not sufficiently focused on addressing this issue , '' the fpc said .
the bank 's prudential regulation authority was `` engaging firms to improve the state of their contingency planning '' .

the fpc also said there was a `` substantial risk '' of disruption to cross-border clearing operations in financial services , such as derivatives used by companies to hedge themselves against potential financial market swings .

documents.title: ferguson leads ftse risers
text: shares in plumbing products maker ferguson ( nee wolseley ) are leading the ftse 100 with a 3 % gain .
investors were cheered by its annual results which saw sales rise 23 % to £ 14.9bn and operating profit rise 25 % to £ 1bn .
the company makes almost 90 % of its profits in the us , so recent strength in the us economy has been good for ferguson .
analysts at peel hunt expect the company to shift its listing to the us .

documents.title: 'unacceptable '
text: strong words from australia 's air safety regulator on the disappearance of malaysia airlines flight mh370 , which says it is `` unacceptable '' that a commercial plane can simply vanish .

`` the reasons for the loss of mh370 can not be established with certainty until the aircraft is found , '' the australian transport safety bureau board says in its final report published on tuesday .

`` it is almost inconceivable and certainly societally unacceptable in the modern aviation era for a large commercial aircraft to be missing and for the world not to know with certainty what became of the aircraft and those on board . ''
the plane with 239 people on board disappeared in march 2014 en route from kuala lumpur to beijing .

documents.title: downturn in building of shops , offices and factories
text: chris williamson is the chief business economist at ihs markit .
particularly worrying downturn in commercial construction # pmi , points to falling uk business investment in offices , shops , factories etc
if only there was an explanation !
why would anyone invest ?
brexit followed by corbyn is hardly a recipe for prosperity .
it is the recession coming

documents.title: breakinguk construction sector moves into reverse
text: the uk construction sector contracted in september , according to the latest purchasing managers survey from ihs/markit .
its index of business activity fell to 48.1 in september , down from 51.1 in august .
any figure below 50 indicates contraction and september was the first month since july 2016 that the number has been below that level .
a shortfall of new work to replace completed projects has started to weigh heavily on the uk construction sector .

aside from the soft patch linked to spending delays around the eu referendum , construction companies have now experienced their longest period of falling workloads since early-2013 , '' said tim moore , associate director at ihs markit .

documents.title: breakingbarnier : not enough progress
text: michel barnier , the eu 's chief brexit negotiatior , says not enough progress had yet been made to unlock talks on a future trade deal between britain and the bloc .
`` today we have not yet achieved sufficient progress to begin in full confidence the second phase of negotiations , '' he told the european parliament in strasbourg .
`` there are still serious divergences , in particular on the financial settlement .
we will not agree to pay at 27 what was decided at 28 , '' he said , referring to the remaining 27 eu member states .

eu leaders are set to decide at a summit starting on 19 october whether enough has been agreed on the divorce to start discussing the future relationship including a trade deal , as britain has demanded .

documents.title: airbus of battery making ?
text: this is interesting .
the european union wants to form an airbus-style consortium to develop and build batteries , according to the financial times .

it reports that a senior official from the european commission will host a summit on 11 october of executives from car makers , chemicals firms and battery manufacturers to try and promote co-operation and offer 2.2bn euros of eu funding .
the idea is to take advantage of an expected boom in demand for batteries as the car industry switches to electric vehicles .

documents.title: japanese shares close at a fresh two-year high
text: tokyo 's benchmark index hit its highest level in more than two years on tuesday , as a weaker yen helped spur gains for japanese exporters .
the nikkei 225 index rose 1.1 % , or 213 points , to close at 20,614.07 .
the bright mood was reflected elsewhere in asia , with hong kong 's hang seng jumping 1.8 % as trading resumed after a holiday on monday .
but australia 's s & p/asx 200 bucked the upbeat trend .
the market fell 0.5 % , or 27 points , to close at 5,701 , as the country 's central bank left rates on hold at record lows of 1.5 % .

documents.title: revolution profits plunge
text: revolution bars said pre-tax profits fell 29 % to £ 3.6m for the year to 1 july after sales growth slowed and costs soared despite a 1.5 % rise in like-for-like sales .
the owner of more than 60 revolution and revolucion de cuba bars issued a profit warning in may , which sent shares tumbling and sparked takeover interest .
slug and lettuce owner stonegate said in august it had struck an agreement to acquire revolution bars for just over £ 100m .
however , nightclub operator deltic group has also considered an approach .
it must do so by 10 october under takeover rules .
deltic has 57 clubs , including those operating under the pryzm , bar and beyond , steinbeck and shaw , atik , and fiction brands .

documents.title: 100 women list
text: lady michelle mone @ twitterid is one of this year 's # 100women .
find out more about this year 's inspiring list :

documents.title: wizz air soars
text: wizz air , the hungarian-based low-cost airline , also has september passenger stats out today .
it flew 2.9 million people last month - a rise of 24 % on last year .
it continues to expand , offering seven new routes , taking the total to 143 .
wizz has also started a scheme whereby a passenger can book up to 10 tickets - without naming who they plan to fly with .
shares in the airline are up a touch at £ 30.18 - and have jumped more than 130 % since it listed in london in march 2015 , making it worth almost £ 2.2bn .
author: Rebecca Marston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: ftse 100 down : wizz and greggs move higher
text: the ftse 100 has started the day with some modest losses .
it 's a few points lower .
among the companies in the news this morning
wizz air is up 0.7 % after its trading update and greggs in 0.9 % higher after releasing its numbers .

documents.title: coca-coca hbc boss dies
text: dimitris lois , the chief executive of coca-coca hbc , has died , the company said today .
he had been on medical leave since september .
no cause of death was revealed , but the company said it would make further announcements in due course .
chairman anastassis david said : `` we are deeply saddened by the news of dimitris 's death .
it was a great privilege to know him personally and to work alongside him for so many years . ''
michalis imellos will continue in the role of acting chief executive .
by the way , coca-coca hbc , which has the rights to bottle and distribute the fizzy drinks in europe , is a ftse 100 company worth £ 9.3bn .

documents.title: monarch faced big shortfall
text: today programme business presenter , dominic o'connell tweets :
@ monarch faced a £ 100m shortfall next year , says monarch airline chief exec andrew swaffield @ twitterid
greybull are keeping very quiet ?

documents.title: brexit 'very challenging '
text: brexit has been `` very challenging '' says angela spindler , the chief executive of n brown .
consumer confidence has been hit by the uncertainty surrounding brexit she says .
also , the weakness of sterling has been hurting n brown as it buys a lot of goods from overseas .
however , the weaker pound is good for its businesses overseas .

documents.title: tips from the top
text: angela spindler , chief executive of n brown , tells bbc breakfast that getting to the top in business requires three things : some talent , some luck - and some courage .
women sometimes fall down on that last point , she says .
`` it 's expected of men that they are going to be successful in their careers , it 's more unusual for women to get to the top of the ladder .
it 's got to come from inside .
`` a lot of it is to do with will , determination and personality . ''
n brown owns numerous brands including simply be , jd williams and jacamo .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: monarch job fairs
text: online business editor mark broad tweets :
# monarch ceo andrew swaffield says talking to rivals airlines about talking on 1,900 ex-employees - also organising job fairs - @ twitterid
@ twitterid could do with a few pilots .
that 's good to see .
not wanting to rub salt and all that send him this .

documents.title: customers ' dreams 'destroyed '
text: should monarch customers have been given more notice about the airline 's problems , so they could have avoided booking with an airline on the brink ?

the problem , says financial times personal finance editor claer barrett , is that if the caa had given any indication that monarch was in trouble then no one would have booked a flight , sealing the airline 's fate .
`` what 's particularly awful in this case is that so many of monarch 's passengers the airline because it was cheap , '' she tells 5 live .
`` you 've got people who have saved up for their only holiday of several years , for a wedding and their dreams have just been destroyed . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: monarch chief : 'we were projected to lose £ 100m '
text: monarch chief : 'we were projected to lose £ 100m '

BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ryanair - packing out planes
text: there 's another detail worth out from ryanair 's statement : the `` load factor '' - how close to full capacity its planes are flying .
a jam-packed 97 % is the answer , which is two percentage points up from last year 's 95 % .
very packed indeed .

documents.title: monarch boss : 'heartbreaking day '
text: in his first interview since the collapse of monarch , chief executive andrew swaffield tells today that monday was a heartbreaking day '' and he apologised for the disruption to customers - and to the nearly 2,000 staff who have now lost their jobs .
he says the airline was expected to lose about £ 100m next year and had `` tried everything '' but just could n't find a way in the end '' to stem the tide of red ink .
the company then made the decision late on saturday night that it had no prospect of continuing , mr swaffied adds .
it tried to operate a normal schedule all day sunday to be ready for the caa rescue flights on monday .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ryanair - refund update
text: along with its latest passenger numbers , ryanair issues another apology for cancelling flights .
it has also issued an update on the compensation for affected passengers .
ryanair says it has now refunded or re-accommodated 98 % of customers who were affected in september and october .
`` we again sincerely apologise to our customers for these deeply regretted cancellations . ''

documents.title: ryanair passenger numbers jump
text: sticking with the airline theme , ryanair has released its regular passenger numbers update .
it flew 11.8 million people last month , 10 % more than in september 2016 , and yes , the figure takes into account the 2,100 cancelled flights .

documents.title: greggs warns of costs headwind
text: the bbc 's sean farrington tweets :
greggs : food ingredient cost pressures are a headwind expect that the rate of increase will begin to ease towards the end of the year
they 're selling actual food in greggs these days ?
translation : inflation is going to drop .

documents.title: tasty results from greggs
text: it 's been a yummy quarter for greggs , with like-for-like sales in company-managed shops soaring 5 % for the 13 weeks to 30 september - compared with a 2.8 % rise for the same period last year .
for the year-to-date , like-for-like sales are up 3.9 % .
the bakery chain has opened 98 new shops , including 37 franchised units , giving a total of 1,830 shops .
`` for the year as a whole we still expect to open 140-150 shops and close 40-50 , a net increase of around 100 .
we have also completed 120 shop refurbishments and remain on track to refurbish around 130 shops this year , '' greggs says .
more good news from the newcastle-based chain too : its autumn/winter menu includes a new `` all-day breakfast '' wrap and thai chicken soup has been added to our `` balanced choice '' range .

documents.title: britvic to close norwich plant
text: britvic is closing a manufacturing site in norwich , at the cost of 242 jobs .
the plant manufactured robinsons and fruit shoot products , output will be shifted to plants east london , leeds and rugby .

documents.title: 'open warfare ' at uber
text: uber 's new chief executive , dara khosrowshahi ( is in the uk today to meet transport for london in a bid to get the ride-hailing app 's licence renewed .

his visit comes as co-founder travis kalanick , who was forced out as chief executive earlier this year but still has a big stake in the company , seeks to appoint two independent directors to the uber board .
sarah lacy of pando , a us investigative journalism website , tells today there is more than a bit of a power struggle '' at the top of uber .
mr kalanick 's bid to appoint two new directors comes as several big investors in uber are suing the company in what she calls an `` unprecedented '' move : this company is in open warfare . ''
ms lacy adds that until mr kalanick is no longer involved in uber , `` nothing will change '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: business pages : uber ; rbs ; tesco
text: the front page of the financial times reports on the departure of uber 's uk boss , just before the company 's chief executive was due to hold talks with authorities in london .
you 'll remember that transport for london last week decided not grant the ride-hailing firm a new licence .
uber 's boss dara khosrowshahi is due hold talks today .
a confidential review of the royal bank of scotland 's restructuring division was originally intended to be made public , reports the times .
there have been calls for the review by the financial conduct authority to be made public .
and the guardian reports that tesco directors were repeatedly warned by junior managers that the supermarket chain was facing a multi-million pound hole in its profits .
in september 2014 tesco admitted that it had overstated profits by £ 250m .
the three directors on trial over charges relating to the accounting scandal have denied wrongdoing and have pleaded not guilty .

documents.title: monarch boss speaks
text: listen to today here .
coming up on @ twitterid - @ twitterid chief executive andrew swaffield .
former , surely ?
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: airline industry 'buoyant ' , says caa chief
text: dame deidre hutton has denied there are widespread problems in the airline industry , despite the recent cancellation of ryanair flights and collapse of monarch airlines .

`` the industry is very buoyant and during this year passenger numbers have been up , airlines have been doing very well and airports have been reporting record numbers of passengers , '' she told bbc breakfast .
referring to monarch , she added : `` that was a particular set of issues for this particular company .
it is very sad and people overseas will be very worried . ''
author: BBC Breakfast
